name: Wasteland adventurer

topics.response_text: Sign says you go south... just look for the rollercoaster. Oh and don't go north, a caravan just got sacked up the road.
Just a hunter, out here killing things and hoping their hides fetch more than the bullets cost to kill 'em.
I could use some Stimpaks... how 'bout some nice Bloatfly Steaks in trade?

topics.topic_text: Do you have anything to trade?
topics.response_text: That's a dangerous question... asked the way a bandit might ask... but since we're close to town I'll trust your good intentions.

topics.topic_text: What if I go around the caravan?
topics.response_text: It just gets worse the further north you go... Deathclaws... death in general. But it's your ass, I suppose.

description:
Marcus Thorne is a 35 year-old Caucasian Male.

A weathered man in his mid-30s with calloused hands and a keen eye that has scanned the Mojave Wasteland for years. He wears practical leather armor reinforced with scrap metal, carries a well-maintained hunting rifle, and keeps a detailed map of the southeastern Mojave tucked into his belt. His face is etched with lines from squinting against the sun and constant vigilance.

Marcus Thorne's Personality: Cautious but pragmatic, Marcus has learned to trust his instincts in the harsh wasteland. He's generally fair in his dealings but expects compensation for his knowledge. He's seen too many good people die from naivety to be overly trusting, but he's not cruelâ€”just realistic about the realities of survival.

Marcus Thorne's Backstory: Born in a small farming community near the Colorado River, Marcus grew up hearing stories about the 'Old World' and the vast wasteland that lay beyond. At 25, restless and seeking more than a life of tending crops, he set out with little more than a rifle and a canteen. For a decade, he has survived as a hunter, scavenger, and information broker, mapping the southeastern Mojave and learning its dangers and secrets. He considers the area around Goodsprings his home base, using a small trailer south of the settlement's water source as his base of operations.
